result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather M Lahue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing at the is subject to civil judgment.

Complete a parenting class.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Follow any CHIPS order and/or Children's Court order.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Heather M Lahue in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Heather M Lahue in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1:   Court ordered the defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to Counts 2 and 3.
As to Count 2:   Court ordered the defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to Counts 1 and 3.
As to Count 3:   Court ordered the defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to Counts 1 and 2.

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/11/2015.
-Mental Health Evaluation and/or any treatment deemed appropriate. Take all medication as prescribed.       
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Maintain sobriety.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS approved by the Court, or agent, or Children's Court order.
-Follow any CHIPS order and/or Children's Court order.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No possession of firearms.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing at the is subject to civil judgment.


Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief,  and Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Heather M Lahue in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1, COUNT #2 and COUNT #3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-18-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Heather M Lahue in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the sole charge to (3) three separate counts of Battery, contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor."   mld

Defendant Heather M Lahue in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for Abbey Marie DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Heather M Lahue in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-27-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Heather M Lahue in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-5-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Heather M Lahue in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Due to Branch 4 in trial, the Preliminary Hearing (Waiver), will be heard by the Prelim Court.   mld
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-25-2015 at 08:30 am.
